name: Blockchain Architecture
description: Understanding the core structure and components of blockchain networks.

cards.title: Block Structure & Data Storage
cards.description: Exploring how data is stored in blocks and linked in a blockchain.
cards.bulletpoints: Block headers, Merkle trees, transaction structures
cards.summaryText: Break down a block into header, body, and Merkle tree so you know exactly how transactions link and stay tamper-evident.

cards.title: Peer-to-Peer Networks
cards.description: How blockchain nodes communicate and validate transactions.
cards.bulletpoints: Node roles, full nodes vs. light nodes, decentralized networks
cards.summaryText: Map node types and gossip protocols to see how decentralized peers relay blocks and reach agreement without central servers.

cards.title: Immutability and Data Integrity
cards.description: Ensuring data cannot be altered or removed from the blockchain.
cards.bulletpoints: Cryptographic hashing, append-only structure, cryptographic proof
cards.summaryText: Follow the hash links and append-only design that make tampering obvious and keep blockchain records provably intact.
